III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation Youth has multiple scrapes above the right eye, a bruise on his
upper inner right arm, scrapes to right hand, scrapes to left knee,
and right knee might be swollen. Youth disclosed that staff at
Eagle Village caused the injures.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was called on June 30, 2023, and a message
was left that included the allegations and a request for a call
back if they had any additional information. Complainant has
not returned the phone call.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Wolverine Human
Services, on July 3, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Youth A reported his time at Putnam was “good”. Youth A
said he had “problems with staff” however was not able to identify
which staff or what the issues were. Youth A said Staff 5 left the
bruise on his inner arm “on purpose” however was not able to
recall when it occurred or what Staff 5 did to leave the bruise.
Youth A said the scratches on his hands were blisters from
shoveling and he picks the scabs open. Youth A said he does not
know where the scratches on his head came from. Youth A said
he enjoyed playing outside while at Putnam house and would dig
holes, play on playground and swings, climb trees, and walk in the
woods. Youth A said he would not be scared of any staff if he
returned to Putnam house.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July
12, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said he
is placed at Putnam house and lived there with Youth A. Youth B
said “things are good” at Putnam house. Youth B said when Youth
A was placed at Putnam he would often get into fights with other
youth and “lots” of restraints. Youth B said Youth A would “break
everything in the house” and was very aggressive towards staff.
Youth B said Youth A would get scratches, bumps, and bruises
because he would “fight” staff when they tried to restraint him.
Youth B said he witnessed many restraints and did not think they
were done inappropriately or aggressively. Youth B said he does
not believe any staff ever tried to or hurt Youth A. Youth B said
Youth A was always outside “getting into stuff” and would get
scratched up from being outside as well. Youth B said he has no
concerns about the way staff treat the youth at Eagle Village.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July
12, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C said he
has lived at Putnam house for four weeks and was there with
Youth A. Youth C said Youth A was restrained “often” and stated
he thought the restraints looked “fine”. Youth C said he never saw
2

a staff member hurt Youth A. Youth C said Youth A never told him
that staff harmed him in any way. Youth C said Youth A was very
destructive and broke many things in the house and around
campus. Youth C said the only concerning thing he ever saw was
Staff 4 “shove [Youth A] to the ground”. Youth C said he did not
have any details of when or where this occurred and stated no
other youth or staff saw this occur.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he has
been a direct care worker at Putnam house for seven months and
worked with Youth A during that time. Staff 1 said Youth A has had
very aggressive behaviors especially over the past month. Staff 1
said Youth A has punched him and broke his glasses, broke many
items around the house, been assaultive to other staff as well as
the other youth in the house. Staff 1 said Youth A has been in
many restraints which are very difficult because he manipulates
the hold and “gets his arms free” and staff cannot keep a hold on
him very well. Staff 1 said Youth A also is very “outdoorsy” and will
be playing on the edge of the woods, climbing trees, and playing
on the playground all which has resulted in some scratches,
bumps, and bruises at times. Staff 1 said he has never seen any
staff mistreat or injury Youth A. Staff 1 said he has never had any
concerns that staff are intentionally causing any injury to Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said he is a
direct care staff at Gerber house however has assisted and
interacted with Youth A many times over the past few months.
Staff 2 said Youth A seems to be “triple jointed and gets out of
restraints often”. Staff 2 said he and a few other staff seemed to
be the only staff that could keep a good restraint hold on Youth A.
Staff 2 said his most recent interaction with Youth A was on June
24, 2023. Staff 2 said Youth A lost at Gaga Ball and became upset
and threw all the balls into the woods. Staff 2 said the other staff
working took the other youth into the gym and he and Supervisor
Z were working with Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A followed behind
his peers and ran into the gym where he was threatening the other
youth as well as threatening to pop all the balls in the gym. Staff 2
said Youth A was kicking things and throwing things around the
gym, so the other staff brought the other youth to the opposite side
of the gym away from Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A got upset by
this and fell to the ground and was trying to bite Staff 2’s legs and
ankles. Staff 2 said he just stood there as Youth A was not really
biting anything and eventually Youth A got up and kicked through
a window breaking glass all over. Staff 2 said Youth A started to
3

climb into the window and he stopped him immediately which
made Youth A mad and turn around and punched a picture on the
wall breaking that glass as well. Staff 2 said Youth A had scratches
on his hand from punching the picture and once calm he cleaned
Youth A’s hands up with peroxide, antibacterial cream, and a
band-aid. Staff 2 said Youth A seemed to always have scratches
on his arms and legs from playing around outside. Staff 2 said
Youth A never disclosed any staff harming him in any way. Staff 2
said he has no knowledge or concerns about any staff intentionally
hurting Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 18,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said he has
been working at Putnam house for one year and four months and
had worked with Youth A. Staff 3 said his last restraint with Youth A
was on June 21, 2023, on a nature trail behind Putnam house.
Staff 3 said Youth A got upset and began to curse at his peers and
throw leaves and sticks towards them. Staff 3 said he was
redirected by him to stop these behaviors and Youth A told him to
stop talking to him and then attempted to punch him at which time
Staff 3 placed Youth A in a restraint. Staff 3 said the restraint was
less than a minute because Youth A was able to get out of the
restraint by wiggling himself to the ground, so he released and
Youth A took off running down the trail. Staff 3 said he was able to
catch up to him and walk with him until he was calm. Staff 3 said
he was not aware of that restraint leaving any marks or scratches
on Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A frequently has scratches on his
arms and legs from being outside playing. Staff 3 said Youth A
enjoyed climbing trees, building forts, digging holes, and walking
through the woods. Staff 3 said Youth A disclosed that a staff had
bit him (This was addressed in SIR 2023C0000483) but otherwise
Youth A never reported any staff harming him in any way. Staff 3
said he did not have concern that staff ever maliciously harmed
Youth A. Staff 3 said Youth A would pick at his scabs daily and
therefore it seemed to take longer for some scratches to fully heal.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 18,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said he has
worked at Eagle Village for eighteen years and currently is
working in Putnam house. Staff 4 said he had interactions with
Youth A throughout his placement at Eagle Village. Staff 4 said
Youth A would “be outside 24/7 if allowed” and was often playing
on the edge of the woods and climbing trees. Staff 4 said Youth A
also liked to take walks on the trails throughout the woods when
allowed and would pick things up all along the way and at times
found glass, nails, or cans. Staff 4 said Youth A seemed to have
4

some superficial scratches on his arms, legs, and sometime face
however was never able to recall where the marks came from
when asked and never complained of any pain from any marks.
Staff 4 said Youth A was also able to bend his body and get out of
restraints and at times would get scratched from that however
Staff 4 said he never saw or heard of any staff maliciously harming
Youth A. Staff 4 said he never pushed Youth A or any other youth.
Staff 4 said Youth A was really struggling with his emotions the
past month and would become very angry with everything around
him resulting in destructive behaviors in the house and assaultive
actions towards staff and other youth. Staff 4 said the last restraint
he had with Youth A was at NEST when Youth A became upset
and tried to jump into the campfire and had to be stopped. Staff 4
said Youth A would constantly pick his scabs and the day he left
was picking a scab from a mark on his face. Staff 4 said he did not
have any concerns that staff were harming Youth A in any way.
Supervisor Y was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
July 12, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor
Y said he is the direct supervisor of Putnam house and had spent
a lot of time with Youth A. Supervisor Y said Youth A spent a lot of
time outside playing on the edge of the woods, carrying around
sticks/branches, digging holes, and climbing trees. Supervisor Y
said over the past month Youth A had become more aggressive
and destructive breaking windows, glass, and being assaultive
towards his peers and staff which resulted in many restraints.
Supervisor Y said Youth A is very difficult to hold in a restraint as
he was able to wiggle out of them and seemed double jointed so
he could get his arms free often. Supervisor Y said Youth A almost
always had some kind of scratches, bumps or bruises from being
so active outside as well as difficult to maintain in restraints.
Supervisor Y said he never had any concerns about staff
mistreating Youth A or causing injury during any of the restraints.
Supervisor Y said Youth A would always need to be redirected for
picking at his scratches, so they never seemed to heal as quickly
as they should because he kept reopening them. Supervisor Y
said he was sitting with Youth A on the day he left Putnam house,
and he was picking at his scabs that morning.
Supervisor Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
July 12, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Supervisor
Z said she does not directly supervise Putnam house however has
had contact with Youth A over the course of his stay at Eagle
Village and most recently assisted in a situation with him on June
24, 2023. Supervisor Z said on June 24, 2023, Youth A was upset
because he lost at a game of gaga ball and threw the balls into the
5

woods. Supervisor Z said she and Staff 2 attempted to verbally
process with him while the other staff working took the other youth
to the gym. Supervisor Z said once Youth A realized the other
youth were being brought to play in the gym, he ran to the gym
and entered. Supervisor Z said Youth A broke a picture that was
hanging on the wall and the glass broke all over the floor.
Supervisor Z said Youth A then went to the sensory room that
connects to the gym where the other youth were and kicked
through the window and started to climb through the window to get
to his peers. Supervisor Z said Staff 2 stopped him and placed him
in a hold to calm him down. Supervisor Z said she did not have
any concerns about the restraint. Supervisor Z said as soon as
Staff 2 had control of Youth A she went into the gym with the other
youth and did not see if Youth A obtained any cuts from the
incident. Supervisor Z said Youth A often has superficial scratches
or bruises on him due to him being very active outside, climbing
trees, playing in the woods, and digging holes. Supervisor Z said
she has never seen or heard of any concerns with the way in
which staff treat or interact with Youth A. Supervisor Z said she
never had Youth A complain to her of any injury.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July 12,
2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Nurse said he saw
Youth A many times throughout his stay at Eagle Village and Youth
A would have superficial scratches and some minor bruising from
playing outside, being in the woods, climbing trees, and carrying
around branches. Nurse said Youth A was last seen on May 22,
2023, due to an alleged bite (SIR 2023C0000483) however at that
time Youth A also had scratches on his hand from hitting
something that was glass. Nurse said Youth A did not have a body
chart done at discharge.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July
12, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Therapist said
she had contact with Youth A at least twice per week and he would
often have scratches on his body. Therapist said Youth A loved to
play outside digging, climbing trees, and playing around the yard
area. Therapist said Youth A was also very “malleable in restraints”
so staff had a difficult time holding him and he would get out of
holds and at times scratch himself when doing so. Therapist said
Youth A never disclosed any staff hurting him or feeling mistreated
by staff. Therapist said Youth A would pick at his scratches and on
the day he was moved to Wolverine Human Services he was
picking the scratches he had on his face. Therapist said she did
not have any concerns regarding staff mistreating Youth A.
6

Tour Observation
A tour of the facility gym occurred on July 18, 2023. There is a
sensory room that leads to a small hallway that has a door to the
gym. The door had a piece of wood covering the window opening
as it was broken. The gym has several rooms and some pictures
throughout the building.
Documents Reviewed
• Staff 5 personnel file: Staff 5’s last shift worked was May
25, 2023. Staff 5 had three days of no call/no show. Staff 5
was terminated on May 30, 2023.
• Youth A’s placement history was reviewed. Youth A was
placed at Eagle Village until June 28, 2023.
• Incident Report dated June 24, 2023, regarding Youth A.
The incident report outlines the events with Youth A running
into the gym and kicking the glass out of a door and
breaking the glass out of a picture on the wall. The incident
report is consistent with Supervisor Z and Staff 2’s
interviews.
• Incident Report dated June 21, 2023, regarding Youth A.
The incident report outlines the restraint of Youth A by Staff
3. The incident report is consistent with Staff 3’s interview.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there is no evidence that a
staff member injured Youth A. All staff and youth reported Youth A
as a very active youth that played in the woods, climbed trees,
and normally had many scratches and bruises from playing
outside. Youth A was not able to identify which staff injured him,
when it occurred, or how it happened.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
